content:
IInputElement Interface

Definition

Establishes the common events and also the event-related properties and methods for basic input processing by Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) elements.

In this Article

public interface IInputElement

Remarks

Important

Although this interface is public, it is not intended to be implemented in application or framework-building scenarios. This interface is public because of the inheritance requirements for connecting the WPF core to the WPF framework. You can also use this interface as a casting mechanism to enforce that the input events and properties will come from either a FrameworkElement or FrameworkContentElement, which can be handled in the same input model. For more information, see WPF Architecture and also see Base Elements Overview.

Properties

Focusable

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether focus can be set to this element.

public bool Focusable { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the element can have focus set to it; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see Focusable and Focusable) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsEnabled

Gets a value that indicates whether this element is enabled in the user interface (UI).

public bool IsEnabled { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the element is enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsEnabled and IsEnabled) make this property read/write and establish this property as a dependency property.

IsKeyboardFocused

Gets a value that indicates whether this element has keyboard focus.

public bool IsKeyboardFocused { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this element has keyboard focus; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsKeyboardFocused and IsKeyboardFocused) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsKeyboardFocusWithin

Gets a value that indicates whether keyboard focus is anywhere inside the element bounds, including if keyboard focus is inside the bounds of any visual child elements.

public bool IsKeyboardFocusWithin { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if keyboard focus is on the element or its child elements; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsKeyboardFocusWithin and IsKeyboardFocusWithin) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsMouseCaptured

Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse is captured to this element.

public bool IsMouseCaptured { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the element has mouse capture; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsMouseCaptured and IsMouseCaptured) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsMouseDirectlyOver

Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse pointer is over this element in the strictest hit testing sense.

public bool IsMouseDirectlyOver { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the mouse pointer is over this element; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsMouseDirectlyOver and IsMouseDirectlyOver) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsMouseOver

Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse pointer is located over this element (including visual children elements that are inside its bounds).

public bool IsMouseOver { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the mouse pointer is over the element or its child elements; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsMouseOver and IsMouseOver) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsStylusCaptured

Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is captured to this element.

public bool IsStylusCaptured { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the element has stylus capture; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsStylusCaptured and IsStylusCaptured) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsStylusDirectlyOver

Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is over this element in the strictest hit testing sense.

public bool IsStylusDirectlyOver { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stylus is over the element; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsStylusDirectlyOver and IsStylusDirectlyOver) establish this property as a dependency property.

IsStylusOver

Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is located over this element (or over visual child elements that are inside its bounds).

public bool IsStylusOver { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stylus cursor is over the element or its child elements; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Some core classes that implement IInputElement, such as UIElement, also implement an event that tracks changes to this property. However, this interface does not include such an event as part of its contract.

Existing implementations in the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) core (see IsStylusOver and IsStylusOver) establish this property as a dependency property.

Methods

AddHandler(RoutedEvent,Delegate)

Adds a routed event handler for a specific routed event to an element.

public void AddHandler (System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent, Delegate handler);
routedEvent
RoutedEvent

The identifier for the routed event that is being handled.

handler
Delegate

A reference to the handler implementation.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

CaptureMouse()

Attempts to force capture of the mouse to this element.

public bool CaptureMouse ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the mouse is successfully captured; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

CaptureStylus()

Attempts to force capture of the stylus to this element.

public bool CaptureStylus ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the stylus is successfully captured; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Focus()

Attempts to focus the keyboard on this element.

public bool Focus ();
Returns
Boolean

true if keyboard focus is moved to this element or already was on this element; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

RaiseEvent(RoutedEventArgs)

Raises the routed event that is specified by the stem.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.RoutedEvent* property within the provided RoutedEventArgs.

public void RaiseEvent (System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs e);
e
RoutedEventArgs

An instance of the RoutedEventArgs class that contains the identifier for the event to raise.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

ReleaseMouseCapture()

Releases the mouse capture, if this element holds the capture.

public void ReleaseMouseCapture ();

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

ReleaseStylusCapture()

Releases the stylus capture, if this element holds the capture.

public void ReleaseStylusCapture ();

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

RemoveHandler(RoutedEvent,Delegate)

Removes all instances of the specified routed event handler from this element.

public void RemoveHandler (System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent, Delegate handler);
routedEvent
RoutedEvent

Identifier of the routed event for which the handler is attached.

handler
Delegate

The specific handler implementation to remove from this element's event handler collection.

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

Events

GotKeyboardFocus

Occurs when the keyboard is focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventHandler GotKeyboardFocus;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

GotMouseCapture

Occurs when the element captures the mouse.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseEventHandler GotMouseCapture;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

When an element captures the mouse, that element receives mouse input even if the cursor is outside its bounds. The mouse is typically captured in this manner only during drag-and-drop operations and retains capture until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs.

GotStylusCapture

Occurs when the element captures the stylus.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler GotStylusCapture;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

When an element captures the stylus, that element receives stylus input even if the cursor is outside its bounds. The stylus is typically captured in this manner only during drag-and-drop operations, and retains capture until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs.

KeyDown

Occurs when a key is pressed while the keyboard is focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyEventHandler KeyDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

KeyUp

Occurs when a key is released while the keyboard is focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyEventHandler KeyUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

LostKeyboardFocus

Occurs when the keyboard is no longer focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventHandler LostKeyboardFocus;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

LostMouseCapture

Occurs when this element loses mouse capture.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseEventHandler LostMouseCapture;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

When an element captures the mouse, it receives mouse input even if the cursor is outside its borders. The mouse is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations.

LostStylusCapture

Occurs when this element loses stylus capture.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler LostStylusCapture;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

When an element captures the stylus, it receives stylus input even if the cursor is outside its borders. The stylus is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations.

MouseEnter

Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the bounds of this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseEventHandler MouseEnter;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

MouseLeave

Occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the bounds of this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseEventHandler MouseLeave;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

MouseLeftButtonDown

Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler MouseLeftButtonDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

MouseLeftButtonUp

Occurs when the left mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler MouseLeftButtonUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

MouseMove

Occurs when the mouse pointer moves while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseEventHandler MouseMove;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

MouseRightButtonDown

Occurs when the right mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler MouseRightButtonDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

MouseRightButtonUp

Occurs when the right mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler MouseRightButtonUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

MouseWheel

Occurs when the mouse wheel moves while the mouse pointer is over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseWheelEventHandler MouseWheel;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewGotKeyboardFocus

Occurs when the keyboard is focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventHandler PreviewGotKeyboardFocus;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewKeyDown

Occurs when a key is pressed while the keyboard is focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyEventHandler PreviewKeyDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewKeyUp

Occurs when a key is released while the keyboard is focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyEventHandler PreviewKeyUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewLostKeyboardFocus

Occurs when the keyboard is no longer focused on this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventHandler PreviewLostKeyboardFocus;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown

Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewMouseLeftButtonUp

Occurs when the left mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler PreviewMouseLeftButtonUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewMouseMove

Occurs when the mouse pointer moves while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseEventHandler PreviewMouseMove;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewMouseRightButtonDown

Occurs when the right mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler PreviewMouseRightButtonDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewMouseRightButtonUp

Occurs when the right mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventHandler PreviewMouseRightButtonUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewMouseWheel

Occurs when the mouse wheel moves while the mouse pointer is over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.MouseWheelEventHandler PreviewMouseWheel;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusButtonDown

Occurs when the stylus button is pressed down while the stylus is over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusButtonEventHandler PreviewStylusButtonDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusButtonUp

Occurs when the stylus button is released while the stylus is over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusButtonEventHandler PreviewStylusButtonUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusDown

Occurs when the stylus touches the digitizer while over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusDownEventHandler PreviewStylusDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusInAirMove

Occurs when the stylus moves over an element, but without touching the digitizer.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler PreviewStylusInAirMove;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusInRange

Occurs when the stylus is close enough to the digitizer to be detected.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler PreviewStylusInRange;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusMove

Occurs when the stylus moves while the stylus is over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler PreviewStylusMove;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusOutOfRange

Occurs when the stylus is too far from the digitizer to be detected.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler PreviewStylusOutOfRange;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusSystemGesture

Occurs when one of several stylus gestures are detected, for example, SystemGesture or SystemGesture.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusSystemGestureEventHandler PreviewStylusSystemGesture;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewStylusUp

Occurs when the stylus is raised off the digitizer while over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler PreviewStylusUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

PreviewTextInput

Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.

public event System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionEventHandler PreviewTextInput;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusButtonDown

Occurs when the stylus button is pressed while the stylus is over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusButtonEventHandler StylusButtonDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusButtonUp

Occurs when the stylus button is released while the stylus is over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusButtonEventHandler StylusButtonUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusDown

Occurs when the stylus touches the digitizer while over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusDownEventHandler StylusDown;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusEnter

Occurs when the stylus cursor enters the bounds of the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler StylusEnter;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusInAirMove

Occurs when the stylus moves over an element, but without touching the digitizer.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler StylusInAirMove;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusInRange

Occurs when the stylus is close enough to the digitizer to be detected.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler StylusInRange;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusLeave

Occurs when the stylus cursor leaves the bounds of the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler StylusLeave;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusMove

Occurs when the stylus cursor moves over the element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler StylusMove;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusOutOfRange

Occurs when the stylus is too far from the digitizer to be detected.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler StylusOutOfRange;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusSystemGesture

Occurs when one of several stylus gestures are detected, for example, SystemGesture or SystemGesture.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusSystemGestureEventHandler StylusSystemGesture;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

StylusUp

Occurs when the stylus is raised off the digitizer while over this element.

public event System.Windows.Input.StylusEventHandler StylusUp;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.

TextInput

Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.

public event System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionEventHandler TextInput;

Remarks

This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the IInputElement interface.
